title: How to Use the Hungarian Algorithm

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/32\/Matrix1_393.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/3\/32\/Matrix1_393.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":301,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":497.45454545454544,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Arrange your information in a matrix with the "people" on the left and the "activity" along the top, with the "cost" for each pair in the middle.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8b\/Matrix2_102.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8b\/Matrix2_102.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":232,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":383.45454545454544,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Ensure that the matrix is square by the addition of dummy rows/columns if necessary.
steps.description: Conventionally, each element in the dummy row/column is the same as the largest number in the matrix.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/da\/Matrix3_952.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/d\/da\/Matrix3_952.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":228,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":376.54545454545456,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Reduce the rows by subtracting the minimum value of each row from that row.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/48\/Matrix4_691.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/48\/Matrix4_691.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":238,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":393.8181818181818,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}If there are columns without a zero, reduce the columns by subtracting the minimum value of each column from that column.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fa\/Matrix5_750.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/f\/fa\/Matrix5_750.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":238,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":393.8181818181818,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cover the zero elements with the minimum number of lines it is possible to cover them with.
steps.description: (If the number of lines is equal to the number of rows then go to step 9)

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b3\/Matrix6_172.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/b\/b3\/Matrix6_172.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":234,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":386.90909090909093,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Add the minimum uncovered element to every covered element.
steps.description: If an element is covered twice, add the minimum element to it twice.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e0\/Matrix7_164.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e0\/Matrix7_164.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":240,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":397.27272727272725,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Subtract the minimum element from every element in the matrix.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c2\/Matrix8_43.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/c\/c2\/Matrix8_43.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":499,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":824.7727272727273,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} This example had to be reduced once more
steps.description: Cover the zero elements again. If the number of lines covering the zero elements is not equal to the number of rows, return to step 6.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4d\/Matrix9_628.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/4\/4d\/Matrix9_628.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":236,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":390.3636363636364,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"}Select a matching by choosing a set of zeros so that each row or column has only one selected.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8b\/Matrix10_838.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/8\/8b\/Matrix10_838.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":297,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":490.1775147928994,"licensing":"

Image by: Uploader
\nLicense: Creative Commons<\/a>\n<\/p><\/div>"} Notice that D has not been used
steps.description: Apply the matching to the original matrix, disregarding dummy rows. This shows who should do which activity, and adding the costs will give the total minimum cost.
